title: Meen Kuzhambu
description: A tangy, spicy fish curry that captures the flavors of coastal cuisine, a seafood lover's paradise.
steps: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
Add tomatoes, green chilies, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook until the oil separates.
Add tamarind extract, salt, and curry leaves. Simmer for a few minutes.
Add fish pieces and cook until they are done.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Chettinad Kozhi Kuzhambu
description: A fiery chicken curry infused with aromatic spices, a signature dish from the Chettinad region.
steps: Heat oil in a pan and add fennel seeds and cumin seeds.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
Add tomatoes, green chilies, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook until the oil separates.
Add chicken pieces and cook until they are no longer pink.
Add coconut milk, salt, and curry leaves. Simmer for a few minutes.
Serve hot with rice or roti.

title: Sambar
description: A hearty South Indian stew brimming with vegetables, lentils, and a burst of tamarind tang.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, drumsticks, etc.)
steps: Pressure cook toor dal until soft and mushy.
Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, asafoetida, and curry leaves.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.
Add tomatoes, green chilies, turmeric powder, and sambar powder. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the mixed vegetables and cook for a few minutes.
Add tamarind extract, salt, and cooked toor dal. Simmer until the vegetables are cooked.
Serve hot with rice, idly or dosa.

title: Dal Makhani
description: Creamy black lentils simmered to perfection in a rich tomato and butter sauce, a North Indian classic.
steps: Soak black lentils and kidney beans overnight. Pressure cook them until soft.
Heat oil and butter in a pan. Add cumin seeds.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, and tomatoes. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the oil separates.
Add cooked lentils and kidney beans. Simmer for some time.
Stir in cream and salt. Cook for a few more minutes.
Serve hot with naan or rice.
